Package ohos.account

Class AccountAbility

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.account.AccountAbility

  • public class AccountAbility
extends Object
    Provides abilities for you to manage and perform operations on your OS accounts.

    This class provides basic account-related functions, including querying and updating the distributed information of an OS account in a distributed system, creating, removing, and starting an OS account, updating OS account information, and querying information about the current OS account or all OS accounts. The distributed information refers to the account information that is used on a distributed network. It affects the availability of the distributed network and the distributed database.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Account#OS_ACCOUNT

    • Method Detail

      • queryOsAccountDistributedInfo

        public DistributedInfo queryOsAccountDistributedInfo​()
        Queries the distributed information of the current OS account.

        Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.MANAGE_LOCAL_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Returns:
        Returns the distributed information of the current OS account; returns null if the query fails.

      • isMultiOSAccountEnable

        public boolean isMultiOSAccountEnable​()
        Checks whether the function of supporting multiple OS accounts is enabled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this function is enabled; returns false otherwise.

      • getOsAccountLocalIdFromUid

        public int getOsAccountLocalIdFromUid​(int uid)
        Queries the local ID of an OS account from the process UID.
        Parameters:
        uid - Indicates the process UID.
        Returns:
        Returns the local ID of the OS account.

      • queryCurrentOsAccount

        public OsAccount queryCurrentOsAccount​()
        Queries information about the current OS account.

        Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.MANAGE_LOCAL_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Returns:
        Returns information about the current OS account; returns null if the query fails.

      • isOsAccountConstraintEnable

        public boolean isOsAccountConstraintEnable​(int localId,
                                           String constraint)
        Checks whether a constraint has been enabled for an OS account based on its local ID.

        Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.MANAGE_LOCAL_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        localId - Indicates the local ID of the OS account.
        constraint - Indicates the constraint to check. The value can be:
        • constraint.wifi.set - Indicates the constraint on configuring the Wi-Fi access point.
        • constraint.sms.use - Indicates the constraint on sending and receiving short messages.
        • constraint.calls.outgoing - Indicates the constraint on making calls.
        • constraint.unknown.sources.install - Indicates the constraint on installing applications from unknown sources.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the constraint has been enabled for the OS account; returns false otherwise.

      • getOsAccountAllConstraints

        public List<String> getOsAccountAllConstraints​(int localId)
        Obtains all constraints of an OS account based on its local ID.

        Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.MANAGE_LOCAL_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        localId - Indicates the local ID of the OS account.
        Returns:
        Returns a list of constraints.

        public int getAllCreatedOsAccounts​()

        Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.MANAGE_LOCAL_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Returns:
        Returns the number of created OS accounts.

      • isOsAccountActive

        public boolean isOsAccountActive​(int localId)
        Checks whether an OS account is active based on its local ID.

        Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.MANAGE_LOCAL_ACCOUNTS or ohos.permission.INTERACT_ACROSS_LOCAL_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        localId - Indicates the local ID of the OS account.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the OS account is active; returns false otherwise.

        Returns:

      • isOsAccountVerified

        public boolean isOsAccountVerified​()
        Checks whether this OS account has been verified.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the OS account has been verified successfully; returns false otherwise.

      • isOsAccountVerified

        public boolean isOsAccountVerified​(int localId)
        Checks whether an OS account has been verified based on its local ID.

        Your application needs to request the ohos.permission.MANAGE_LOCAL_ACCOUNTS or ohos.permission.INTERACT_ACROSS_LOCAL_ACCOUNTS permission.

        Parameters:
        localId - Indicates the local ID of the OS account.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the OS account has been verified successfully; returns false otherwise.

      • getOsAccountTypeFromProcess

        public OsAccountType getOsAccountTypeFromProcess​()
        Obtains the type of this OS account from the current process.
        Returns:
        Returns the OS account type. The value can be OsAccountType#ADMIN, OsAccountType#NORMAL, and OsAccountType#GUEST.

      • getDistributedVirtualDeviceId

        public String getDistributedVirtualDeviceId​()
        Obtains the distributed virtual device ID (DVID).

        If the same HarmonyOS account has logged in to multiple devices, these devices constitute a super device through the distributed networking. On the networked devices, you can call this method to obtain the DVIDs. The same application running on different devices obtains the same DVID, whereas different applications obtain different DVIDs.

        Permissions: SystemPermission.DISTRIBUTED_DATASYNC

        Returns:
        Returns the DVID if obtained; returns an empty string if no HarmonyOS account has logged in.
        Since:
        5

      • getAccountAbility

        public static AccountAbility getAccountAbility​()
        Obtains the AccountAbility instance.
        Returns:
        Returns the AccountAbility instance.
